description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up

description:
Labour claims its Education Tax on private schools is to raise revenue for the state sector. But it's unlikely to do that – and no wonder when the policy's architect is clear that it wants private schools to disappear.

The post Labour’s Tax on Education Has One True Goal: to Abolish Private Schools appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Labour’s Tax on Education Has One True Goal: to Abolish Private Schools

description:
Nigel Farage has not come to Scotland during the General Election campaign because it is too “dangerous” after he was attacked by far Left activists the last time he visited, Richard Tice has said.

The post Farage Won’t Visit Scotland Because it’s Too Dangerous After He Was Attacked by Far Left on Last Visit appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Farage Won’t Visit Scotland Because it’s Too Dangerous After He Was Attacked by Far Left on Last Visit

description:
It's increasingly common for parents to track their teenage children using a mobile phone app. Joanna Gray wonders if she missed the bit where we decided this was okay. Whatever happened to learning independence?

The post Did I Miss the Bit Where We Decided it Was Okay to Track Children? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Did I Miss the Bit Where We Decided it Was Okay to Track Children?

description:
The retired British Colonel Richard Kemp has written a piece accusing Nigel Farage of "playing into our enemies' hands" by saying Putin is worried about NATO. Noah Carl provides a point-by-point rebuttal of Kemp's article.

The post Nigel Farage is Right That Putin is Worried About NATO – And Richard Kemp is Wrong appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Nigel Farage is Right That Putin is Worried About NATO – And Richard Kemp is Wrong

description:
Government psychological manipulation of the public has become normal in the U.K. in a trend consolidated during Covid. Dr Gary Sidley traces the roots of this illiberal movement.

The post How Government Psychological Manipulation of the Public Became Normal appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: How Government Psychological Manipulation of the Public Became Normal

description:
In ruling that oil cannot be extracted without taking into account its impact on Net Zero, the U.K. Supreme Court has delivered yet another blow to the country's dying industries, says Ben Pile, not to mention parliamentary sovereignty.

The post Climate Lawfare Will Destroy What Remains of Britain’s Industries appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Climate Lawfare Will Destroy What Remains of Britain’s Industries

description:
In the latest episode of the Weekly Sceptic, the talking points are the Matrix attack on Farage, the Tories' catastrophic election campaign and Keir Starmer's hidden agenda.

The post Nick Dixon and Toby Young Talk About Nigel Farage Being Piled on For Claiming Putin Was ‘Provoked’, the Tories’ Doom Spiral and Keir Starmer’s Hidden Agenda appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Nick Dixon and Toby Young Talk About Nigel Farage Being Piled on For Claiming Putin Was ‘Provoked’, the Tories’ Doom Spiral and Keir Starmer’s Hidden Agenda
